column4: Make an entry for the MAC address of your network interface in /etc/iftab similar to, "eth1 mac 00:0e:35:xx:xx:xx"
I've only been using it for 2 days.  It's been wlan0 on one bootup, and eth1 on this bootup.  Could it be that between my first and second bootup, the mapping got added to iftab automatically?
Sure.  Maybe see if it stays as eth1 on future boot-ups.  If so, then I'd say that's probably what happened.
